Art. 4.247 
Revocation of renunciation 
Where the agreement as to succession entails, on the part of the signatories, a renunciation of rights in an unopened succession, the said renunciation may be revoked by the renouncing party in the following cases: 
1¡ if the beneficiary of the renunciation has made an attempt on the life of the renouncing party; 
2¡ if the beneficiary has been guilty of abuse, misdemeanour or serious insult towards the renouncing party.
Unless otherwise provided for in the agreement, revocation has effect only in respect of the renunciation made by the renouncing party in favour of the beneficiary.
Revocation is never automatic. The request for revocation must be made within one year from the date of the event attributed by the renouncing party to the beneficiary of the renunciation or from the date on which the renouncing party became aware of the event and, at the latest, on the date on which the liquidation and partition of the estate is completed.
